verses.verse: הִנָּ֨ךְ <S%H2005><s%> hin-Nach behold יָפָ֤ה <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fah Behold thou [art] fair רַעְיָתִי֙ <S%H7474><s%> ra'-ya-Ti my love הִנָּ֣ךְ <S%H2005><s%> hin-Nach behold יָפָ֔ה <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fah, behold thou [art] fair עֵינַ֣יִךְ <S%H5869><s%> 'ei-Na-yich eyes יוֹנִ֔ים <S%H3123><s%> yo-Nim, thou [hast] doves' מִבַּ֖עַד <S%H1157><s%> mib-Ba-'ad within לְצַמָּתֵ֑ךְ <S%H6777><s%> le-tzam-ma-Tech; thy locks שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ <S%H8181><s%> sa'-reCh thy hair כְּעֵ֣דֶר <S%H5739><s%> ke-'E-der [is] as a flock הָֽעִזִּ֔ים <S%H5795><s%> ha-'iz-Zim, of goats שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ <S%H1570><s%> sheg-gal-Shu that appear מֵהַ֥ר <S%H2022><s%> me-Har from mount גִּלְעָֽד׃ <S%H1568><s%> gil-'Ad. Gilead

שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H8127><s%> shin-Na-yich Thy teeth כְּעֵ֣דֶר <S%H5739><s%> ke-'E-der [are] like a flock הַקְּצוּב֔וֹת <S%H7094><s%> hak-ke-tzu-Vot, [of sheep that are even] shorn שֶׁעָל֖וּ <S%H5927><s%> she-'a-Lu which came up מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- up הָרַחְצָ֑ה <S%H7367><s%> ha-rach-Tzah; from the washing שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ <S%H3605><s%> shek-kul-Lam All מַתְאִימ֔וֹת <S%H8382><s%> mat-'i-Mot, whereof every one bear twins וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה <S%H7909><s%> ve-shak-ku-Lah and none [is] barren אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein one בָּהֶֽם׃ ba-Hem.

כְּח֤וּט <S%H2339><s%> ke-Chut [are] like a thread הַשָּׁנִי֙ <S%H8144><s%> hash-sha-Ni of scarlet שִׂפְתֹתַ֔יִךְ <S%H8193><s%> sif-to-Ta-yich, Thy lips וּמִדְבָּרֵ֖יךְ <S%H4057><s%> u-mid-ba-Reich and thy speech נָאוֶ֑ה <S%H5000><s%> na-Veh; [is] comely כְּפֶ֤לַח <S%H6400><s%> ke-Fe-lach [are] like a piece הָֽרִמּוֹן֙ <S%H7416><s%> ha-rim-mOn of a pomegranate רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ <S%H7541><s%> rak-ka-Tech, thy temples מִבַּ֖עַד <S%H1157><s%> mib-Ba-'ad within לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃ <S%H6777><s%> le-tzam-ma-Tech. thy locks

כְּמִגְדַּ֤ל <S%H4026><s%> ke-mig-Dal [is] like the tower דָּוִיד֙ <S%H1732><s%> da-Vid of David צַוָּארֵ֔ךְ <S%H6677><s%> tzav-va-Rech, Thy neck בָּנ֖וּי <S%H1129><s%> ba-Nui builded לְתַלְפִּיּ֑וֹת <S%H8530><s%> le-tal-pi-Yot; for an armoury אֶ֤לֶף <S%H505><s%> 'E-lef a thousand הַמָּגֵן֙ <S%H4043><s%> ham-ma-Gen bucklers תָּל֣וּי <S%H8518><s%> ta-Lui whereon there hang עָלָ֔יו <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lav, and כֹּ֖ל <S%H3605><s%> kol All שִׁלְטֵ֥י <S%H7982><s%> shil-Tei all shields הַגִּבּוֹרִֽים׃ <S%H1368><s%> hag-gib-bo-Rim. of mighty men

שְׁנֵ֥י <S%H8147><s%> she-Nei Thy two שָׁדַ֛יִךְ <S%H7699><s%> sha-Da-yich breasts כִּשְׁנֵ֥י <S%H8147><s%> kish-Nei [are] like two עֳפָרִ֖ים <S%H6082><s%> 'o-fa-Rim young תְּאוֹמֵ֣י <S%H8380><s%> te-'o-Mei that are twins צְבִיָּ֑ה <S%H6646><s%> tze-vi-Yah; roes הָרוֹעִ֖ים <S%H7462><s%> ha-ro-'Im which feed בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <S%H7799><s%> bash-sho-shan-Nim. among the lilies

עַ֤ד <S%H5704><s%> 'ad Until שֶׁיָּפ֙וּחַ֙ <S%H6315><s%> shei-ya-Fu-ach break הַיּ֔וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom, Until the day וְנָ֖סוּ <S%H5127><s%> ve-Na-su flee away הַצְּלָלִ֑ים <S%H6752><s%> hatz-tze-la-Lim; and the shadows אֵ֤לֶךְ <S%H1980><s%> 'E-lech will go לִי֙ li אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to הַ֣ר <S%H2022><s%> har me to the mountain הַמּ֔וֹר <S%H4753><s%> ham-Mor, of myrrh וְאֶל־ <S%H413><s%> ve-'el- and to גִּבְעַ֖ת <S%H1389><s%> giv-'At and to the hill הַלְּבוֹנָֽה׃ <S%H3828><s%> hal-le-vo-Nah. of frankincense

כֻּלָּ֤ךְ <S%H3605><s%> kul-Lach are altogether יָפָה֙ <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fah Thou [art] all fair רַעְיָתִ֔י <S%H7474><s%> ra'-ya-Ti, my love וּמ֖וּם <S%H3971><s%> u-Mum [there is] no spot אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein and there בָּֽךְ׃ Bach. ס sa-Mek

אִתִּ֤י <S%H854><s%> 'it-Ti from מִלְּבָנוֹן֙ <S%H3844><s%> mil-le-va-nOn with me from Lebanon כַּלָּ֔ה <S%H3618><s%> kal-Lah, [my] spouse אִתִּ֖י <S%H854><s%> 'it-Ti from מִלְּבָנ֣וֹן <S%H3844><s%> mil-le-va-Non with me from Lebanon תָּב֑וֹאִי <S%H935><s%> ta-Vo-'i; Come תָּשׁ֣וּרִי׀ <S%H7789><s%> ta-Shu-ri look מֵרֹ֣אשׁ <S%H7218><s%> me-Rosh from the top אֲמָנָ֗ה <S%H549><s%> 'a-ma-Nah, of Amana מֵרֹ֤אשׁ <S%H7218><s%> me-Rosh from the top שְׂנִיר֙ <S%H8149><s%> se-Nir of Shenir וְחֶרְמ֔וֹן <S%H2768><s%> ve-cher-Mon, and Hermon מִמְּעֹנ֣וֹת <S%H4585><s%> mi-me-'o-Not dens אֲרָי֔וֹת <S%H738><s%> a-ra-Yot, from the lions' מֵֽהַרְרֵ֖י <S%H2042><s%> me-har-Rei from the mountains נְמֵרִֽים׃ <S%H5246><s%> ne-me-Rim. of the leopards

לִבַּבְתִּ֖נִי <S%H3823><s%> lib-bav-Ti-ni Thou hast ravished my heart אֲחֹתִ֣י <S%H269><s%> 'a-cho-Ti my sister כַלָּ֑ה <S%H3618><s%> chal-Lah; [my] spouse לִבַּבְתִּ֙ינִי֙ <S%H3823><s%> lib-bav-Ti-ni thou hast ravished my heart; בְּאַחַד be-'a-chad כבְּאַחַ֣ת <S%H259><s%> be-'a-Chat A single קמֵעֵינַ֔יִךְ <S%H5869><s%> me-'ei-Na-yich, of thine eyes בְּאַחַ֥ד <S%H259><s%> be-'a-Chad with one עֲנָ֖ק <S%H6060><s%> 'a-Nak chain מִצַּוְּרֹנָֽיִךְ׃ <S%H6677><s%> mitz-tzav-ve-ro-Na-yich. of thy neck

מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- How יָּפ֥וּ <S%H3302><s%> ya-Fu How fair דֹדַ֖יִךְ <S%H1730><s%> do-Da-yich is thy love אֲחֹתִ֣י <S%H269><s%> 'a-cho-Ti my sister כַלָּ֑ה <S%H3618><s%> chal-Lah; [my] spouse מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- How טֹּ֤בוּ <S%H2895><s%> Tou how much better דֹדַ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H1730><s%> do-Da-yich is thy love מִיַּ֔יִן <S%H3196><s%> mi-Ya-yin, than wine וְרֵ֥יחַ <S%H7381><s%> ve-Rei-ach and the smell שְׁמָנַ֖יִךְ <S%H8081><s%> she-ma-Na-yich of thine ointments מִכָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> mik-kol all בְּשָׂמִֽים׃ <S%H1314><s%> be-sa-Mim. than all spices

נֹ֛פֶת <S%H5317><s%> No-fet [as] the honeycomb תִּטֹּ֥פְנָה <S%H5197><s%> tit-To-fe-nah drop שִׂפְתוֹתַ֖יִךְ <S%H8193><s%> sif-to-Ta-yich Thy lips כַּלָּ֑ה <S%H3618><s%> kal-Lah; O [my] spouse דְּבַ֤שׁ <S%H1706><s%> de-Vash honey וְחָלָב֙ <S%H2461><s%> ve-cha-Lav and milk תַּ֣חַת <S%H8478><s%> Ta-chat are under לְשׁוֹנֵ֔ךְ <S%H3956><s%> le-sho-Nech, [are] under thy tongue וְרֵ֥יחַ <S%H7381><s%> ve-Rei-ach and the smell שַׂלְמֹתַ֖יִךְ <S%H8008><s%> sal-mo-Ta-yich of thy garments כְּרֵ֥יחַ <S%H7381><s%> ke-Rei-ach [is] like the smell לְבָנֽוֹן׃ <S%H3844><s%> le-va-Non. of Lebanon ס sa-Mek

גַּ֥ן׀ <S%H1588><s%> gan A garden נָע֖וּל <S%H5274><s%> na-'Ul inclosed אֲחֹתִ֣י <S%H269><s%> 'a-cho-Ti [is] my sister כַלָּ֑ה <S%H3618><s%> chal-Lah; [my] spouse גַּ֥ל <S%H1530><s%> gal a spring נָע֖וּל <S%H5274><s%> na-'Ul shut up מַעְיָ֥ן <S%H4599><s%> ma'-Yan a fountain חָתֽוּם׃ <S%H2856><s%> cha-Tum. sealed

שְׁלָחַ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H7973><s%> she-la-Cha-yich Thy plants פַּרְדֵּ֣ס <S%H6508><s%> par-Des [are] an orchard רִמּוֹנִ֔ים <S%H7416><s%> rim-mo-Nim, of pomegranates עִ֖ם <S%H5973><s%> 'im with פְּרִ֣י <S%H6529><s%> pe-Ri fruits מְגָדִ֑ים <S%H4022><s%> me-ga-Dim; with pleasant כְּפָרִ֖ים <S%H3724><s%> ke-fa-Rim camphire עִם־ <S%H5973><s%> 'im- with נְרָדִֽים׃ <S%H5373><s%> ne-ra-Dim. with spikenard

נֵ֣רְדְּ׀ <S%H5373><s%> Ne-red Spikenard וְכַרְכֹּ֗ם <S%H3750><s%> ve-char-Kom, and saffron קָנֶה֙ <S%H7070><s%> ka-Neh calamus וְקִנָּמ֔וֹן <S%H7076><s%> ve-kin-na-Mon, and cinnamon עִ֖ם <S%H5973><s%> 'im along כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all עֲצֵ֣י <S%H6086><s%> 'a-Tzei with all trees לְבוֹנָ֑ה <S%H3828><s%> le-vo-Nah; of frankincense מֹ֚ר <S%H4753><s%> mor myrrh וַאֲהָל֔וֹת <S%H174><s%> va-'a-ha-Lot, and aloes עִ֖ם <S%H5973><s%> 'im along כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all רָאשֵׁ֥י <S%H7218><s%> ra-Shei with all the chief בְשָׂמִֽים׃ <S%H1314><s%> ve-sa-Mim. spices

מַעְיַ֣ן <S%H4599><s%> ma'-Yan A fountain גַּנִּ֔ים <S%H1588><s%> gan-Nim, of gardens בְּאֵ֖ר <S%H875><s%> be-'Er a well מַ֣יִם <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim waters חַיִּ֑ים <S%H2416><s%> chai-Yim; of living וְנֹזְלִ֖ים <S%H5140><s%> ve-no-ze-Lim and streams מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- at לְבָנֽוֹן׃ <S%H3844><s%> le-va-Non. from Lebanon

ע֤וּרִי <S%H5782><s%> 'U-ri Awake צָפוֹן֙ <S%H6828><s%> tza-fOn O north wind וּב֣וֹאִי <S%H935><s%> u-Vo-'i and come תֵימָ֔ן <S%H8486><s%> tei-Man, thou south הָפִ֥יחִי <S%H6315><s%> ha-Fi-chi blow גַנִּ֖י <S%H1588><s%> gan-Ni upon my garden יִזְּל֣וּ <S%H5140><s%> yiz-ze-Lu thereof may flow out בְשָׂמָ֑יו <S%H1314><s%> ve-sa-Mav; [that] the spices יָבֹ֤א <S%H935><s%> ya-Vo come דוֹדִי֙ <S%H1730><s%> do-Di Let my beloved לְגַנּ֔וֹ <S%H1588><s%> le-gan-No, into his garden וְיֹאכַ֖ל <S%H398><s%> ve-yo-Chal and eat פְּרִ֥י <S%H6529><s%> pe-Ri fruits מְגָדָֽיו׃ <S%H4022><s%> me-ga-Dav. his pleasant
